column4: After installing my ubuntu 11.04, I saw that it doesn't have an option to Hibernate, when I did some googling, it sound like the OS came with Hibernate b4. even my friend who uses the same machine am using have a Hibernate option. my question is how do I add Hibernate to my OS?
do you have a swap partition?
is it bigger than your ram?
is the swap partition bigger than your ram size
then that is why you can't hibernate
hibernate requires a swap partition bigger than your ram
it won't give you the option because you don't have sufficient swap
i suppose you can make a bigger swap and restart then the option should appear
make sure you're not using the swap partition while you resize it
how do I stop the swap? I tried killing the pid but it didn't work
i find it easier to use gparted, you can do it all there
Do you think 5000MB is good
good for what?
ah yes, sorry; 5000MB is under 5GB
a general rule for a swap size is roughly 1.5 times the size of ram
that is a waste of diskdrive space
I deleted the swap partition and created new one 5GB and restarted the machine, but still the Hibernate is not showing
hi
got hibernate working?
does it boot quicker than a cold boot?
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hibernation_(computing)
if it's the same speed, i don't see the point in using it, it would just drain battery power
